alert.note: Alert for Coastal Miami Dade County; Metro Broward County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 4:09PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Miami-Dade County through 515 PM EDT... At 409 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm over Miami Springs, or near Hialeah. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Miami, Hialeah, Miramar, Coral Gables, South Miami, Miami Gardens, North Miami, Doral, North Miami Beach, Miami Lakes, Hialeah Gardens, Opa-Locka, Miami Springs, Miami Shores, West Miami, El Portal, Medley, Westchester, Gladeview and Glenvar Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Miami Dade County; Metro Broward County; Metropolitan Miami Dade
